title: Ivanhoe founder Robert Friedland awarded Mongolia’s Order of the Polar Star
content: Mining billionaire Robert Friedland, founder of Ivanhoe Mines (TSX: IVN) and Ivanhoe Electric (TSX: IE), has been formally recognized by the government of Mongolia for his valuable contributions to the country’s mining industry.

title: Supreme Court of Canada rules federal environmental impact law is unconstitutional
content: A federal environmental law that regulates natural-resource projects in the provinces is unconstitutional, the Supreme Court ruled 5-2 on Friday.

title: US DOI draft study poses further setback for Alaska’s Ambler road project
content: The proposed 211-mile transportation corridor for accessing untouched mineral deposits in northwestern Alaska, also known as the Ambler road project, will likely cause harm to wildlife and disruptions to local communities, according to the latest environmental review by the Biden administration.

title: New resource bolsters Rio Tinto-backed Arizona Sonoran’s Cactus copper project
content: Arizona Sonoran Copper (TSX: ASCU) has nearly tripled its measured and indicated resource at the Cactus porphyry project on the site of the past-producing Sacaton mine south of Phoenix.

title: Winshear Gold moves on from Tanzania project, takes $30 million settlement
content: Canadian gold explorer Winshear Gold (TSXV: WINS) has ended a longstanding dispute with the Tanzanian government in regards to the company's licences for the SMP project. On Monday, the parties have reached a $30 million settlement, of which the company...

title: Newcrest reports lower quarterly gold output on maintenance shutdowns
content: Planned maintenance activities at the miner's Cadia, Telfer, Brucejack projects resulted in a lower throughput.

title: Egyptian tycoon eyes stake in Barrick’s Reko Diq project
content: Egyptian billionaire Naguib Sawiris, the northern African country’s second-wealthiest person, is said to be seeking a stake in the $7 billion Reko Dick copper-gold project, jointly owned by Barrick Gold (NYSE: GOLD) (TSX: ABX) and Pakistan.

title: Peru’s economy weaker than expected in August, shrinks 0.63% y/y
content: Peru’s economy shrank by 0.63% in August compared to the same month a year earlier, undershooting analysts’ expectations, figures from the national statistics institute (INEI) showed on Sunday.

title: Peru’s copper production up 7.5% in August
content: Copper production in Peru rose 7.5% year-over-year in August, official data showed on Friday, as output of the red metal totaled about 223,000 metric tons for the month.
